title: Republican healthcare bill would gut the effort to prevent disease outbreaks before they start

organizations.name: centers for disease control and prevention

text:
18 
Preventive care lowers healthcare costs. Full stop. It’s cheaper to vaccinate than to combat a flu or measles outbreak, and that’s a story you can repeat for health threat after health threat. But Donald Trump and Republicans are not interested in that: 
… the new health care replacement bill released Monday night by Republican leaders in Congress would slash a billion-dollar prevention fund designed to help protect against those and other threats. 
The Prevention and Public Health Fund accounts for 12 percent of the budget for the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The 2010 Affordable Care Act set it up specifically to try to lower health costs by preventing diseases before they happen. 
And then once people get sick for lack of preventive care, they’ll be less likely to have insurance and there’ll be less overall funding to combat public threats. 
The Republican way of governing, ladies and gentlemen.
